summary: PROBLEMS WITH AC/HEATER WIRING HARNESS.  THE BLOWER MOTOR FOR THE AC/HEATER SYSTEM IN THE VAN CONTINUES TO OVERLOAD AND BURN OUT COMPONENTS FOR THIS SYSTEM.  THE VAN HAS BEEN PUT INTO REPAIR ON FOUR SEPERATE OCCASIONS.  IT HAS NOW ONCE AGAIN BURNED OUT.  HERE IS SOME INFORMATION:  TURNED IN ON 6/18/99.  REPLACED BLOWER MOTOR RESISTOR.  MILEAGE 24010  TURNED IN ON 9/16/99.  REPLACED BLOWER MOTOR RESISTOR, REPAIRED WIRING HARNESS AND SLEEVE.  MILEAGE 26434  TURNED IN ON 12/14/99.  REPLACED CONTROL HEAD AND BLOWER SWITCH.  MILEAGE 29880.  TURNED IN ON 8/15/02.  REPLACED BLOWER MOTOR SWITCH.  REPLACE BLOWER MOTOR HARNESS WHEN SWITCH FAILED.  TURNING IN AGAIN NEXT WEEK FOR REPAIRS.  CHRYSLER HEADQUATERS AND THE DEALERSHIP STATE THAT THIS IS MY PROBLEM.    MY CONCERN IS THAT IF THE UNDERLING PROBLEM IS NOT FIXED, THEN A POTENTIAL FIRE HAZARD EXISTS WHEN THE WIRING HARNESS OR OTHER PARTS ONCE AGAIN BURN OUT.
